CAPITALISED ON.Definition: took advantage of and made the most of them

ENGAGED.Definition: was actively involved or committed to it

CONMAN.Definition: person who tricked or deceived others for personal gain

TRICKSTER.Definition: person who cheated or deceived people

SKIPPED TOWN.Definition: left the place quickly to escape trouble

CON MAN.Definition: person who engaged in deceitful or illegal activities

FOR THE MOST PART.Definition: mostly, generally, in the majority of cases

GRAIN.Definition: cereal crops like wheat, oats, or barley

DILIGENT.Definition: showing care and effort in his work

CON ARTIST.Definition: a person skilled at deceiving others for personal gain

OVERCHARGED.Definition: asked them to pay too much for something

BOOMED.Definition: experienced rapid growth or a significant increase

LOGISTICS.Definition: the detailed organisation of complex operations

STAUNCH.Definition: strongly committed to or supporting a cause

ABOLITIONIST.Definition: a person who opposed and wanted to end slavery

DREW TO A CLOSE.Definition: came to an end or conclusion

DRYING UP.Definition: gradually reducing or coming to an end

CRUDE OIL.Definition: unrefined or not processed oil as it comes from the ground

SPECULATORS.Definition: investors who engaged in risky financial activities

LAYING DRILLS.Definition: installing equipment to extract oil from the ground

AT THE MERCY OF.Definition: helpless or vulnerable to the control of

SEESAW.Definition: back-and-forth movement, like a playground toy

REFINING.Definition: the process of purifying or improving it

UPSIDE.Definition: positive aspect or potential for gain

KEROSENE.Definition: a flammable oil used as fuel, especially for lamps

BYPRODUCTS.Definition: secondary products produced during the process

THE NUMBERS MAN.Definition: a person who was skilled with calculations and data

TAR.Definition: a thick, sticky substance produced from organic materials

PLOUGHED.Definition: invested or used the earnings to reinvest in a business

BUYING OUT.Definition: buying all the shares or assets of a company

PYTHON.Definition: a type of snake known for its size and constricting ability

ENABLED.Definition: made it possible or allowed it to happen

CUT-THROAT.Definition: fiercely competitive, willing to do anything to succeed

DIVIDENDS.Definition: payments made to shareholders from the company's profits

DEALMAKING.Definition: the activity of negotiating and making deals

BY ALL ACCOUNTS.Definition: according to what most people say or believe

AMASS.Definition: collect or gather a large quantity of it

PHILANTHROPY.Definition: the practice of donating money to help others

ROBBER BARON.Definition: wealthy businessperson who is seen as unethical or cruel

PHILANTHROPIST.Definition: person who gave to charitable causes or organisations

DOUBLE-CROSSING.Definition: deceitful or betraying other people's trust

TYCOON.Definition: a wealthy, influential, or powerful businessperson
